    • Method Detail

      • setLogLevel

        public static void setLogLevel(int newLogLevel)
        sets the logging level to the absolute value of newLogLevel The logging level determines which log statements are recorded. The default value is 2, indicating that debug messages, warnings, and errors should all be logged.
        Parameters:
        newLogLevel - the new log level. A value greater/equal to 2 will log all messages. A value of 1 will log only warnings and errors. A value of 0 or less will only log errors.

      • c

        public static void c(String tag,
     String message)
        write a message to the console. Write a message to the console . This message is not duplicated in the log.
        Parameters:
        tag - a String to identify the source of this message
        message - the message to print to the console
